intro: Ludwigia prieurea, commonly known as the red Ludwigia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and along riverbanks. Its leaves are usually oval-shaped and may have a reddish or purple hue. Ludwigia prieurea is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in water gardens and ponds.
